clinical_study.brief_title: IMR Assessment in Patients With New Diagnosis of Left Ventricle Dilatation
clinical_study.official_title: Index of Microcirculatory Resistance (IMR) Assessment in Patients With New Diagnosis of Left Ventricular Dilatation Without Significant Coronary Artery Lesions: IMPAIRED Pilot Trial

brief_summary.textblock: To establish if, in patients with new diagnosis of left ventricular dilatation without documentation at the coronary artery angiography of significant coronary artery lesions, there is a damage of the coronary microcirculation at the IMR (index of microcirculatory resistance) assessment

detailed_description.textblock:
The Authors will enroll at the moment of coronary artery angiography patients without history of ischemic heart disease and new diagnosis (at transthoracic echocardiography) of left ventricular dilation.
All patients will undergo coronary artery angiography. To be enrolled, it is necessary to have the absence of significant coronary artery stenosis (angiographic evaluation of the lesion >40%) in all the vessels (main and side branch).
The Authors will proceed to perform the evaluation of the index of microvascular resistance (IMR). The target vessel will be the left anterior descending artery.
An intracoronary pressure/temperature sensor-tipped guidewire will be used. Thermodilution curves will be obtained during maximal hyperemia. The IMR will be calculated from the ratio of the mean distal coronary pressure at maximal hyperemia to the inverse of mean hyperemic transit time.

primary_outcome.description: Measurement of IMR in the left anterior descending artery of patients with new diagnosis of left ventricular dilatation and no significant stenosis in epicardial coronary arteries

secondary_outcome.description: occurrence of cardiac death at 1 year

other_outcome.description: occurrence of all-cause death at 1 year
occurrence of hospital admission for heart failure

arm_group.description: The subjects of the investigation will be patients with recent diagnosis of unknown left ventricle dilatation. These subjects received coronary artery angiography as exam suggested by guidelines to discriminate the cause of left ventricle dilatation. In subjects without documentation of coronary artery lesions, the Authors will assess the index of microvascular resistance.

intervention.description: Measurement of the index of microvascular resistance in the left anterior descending artery

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing coronary artery angiography for new diagnosis of left ventricular dilatation (dilatative cardiomyopathy)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- new diagnosis of left ventricular dilation (dilatative cardiopathy)
- absence of significant (>40%) coronary artery disease at coronary artery angiography
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of ischemic heart disease
- history of significant valvular disease
- contraindication to hyperemic agent
